tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE audit_log (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    operation VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    user_id UUID,
    data JSONB
)

CREATE TABLE audit_log (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(255),
    action VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE user_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    data VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE data_changes (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    change_id INT,
    old_data VARCHAR(255),
    new_data VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE audit_log (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  action VARCHAR(255),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  user_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(255),
  email VARCHAR(255),
  role VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE data_changes (
  change_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  table_name VARCHAR(255),
  column_name VARCHAR(255),
  old_value TEXT,
  new_value TEXT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE audit_log_history (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  previous_log_id INT,
  action VARCHAR(255),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  action VARCHAR(50),
  user_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50),
  role VARCHAR(50),
  created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE data_changes (
  change_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  table_name VARCHAR(50),
  change_type VARCHAR(50),
  change_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE tables_audited (
  table_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  table_name VARCHAR(50),
  last_audit_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE audit_config (
  config_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  enabled BOOLEAN,
  audit_log_table VARCHAR(50),
  audit_level VARCHAR(50)
)
